wikipedia_page.main: Geoffrey Norman Edward Hall-Say (27 April 1864 – 21 January 1940) was a British figure skater. He won the bronze medal in the special figures event at the 1908 Summer Olympics, became one of the oldest figure skating Olympic medalists. This was the only year in which special figures was an Olympic event. Fellow Brit Arthur Cumming won the silver.
